title: Formative Assessment Utilization Based on Cognitive Apprenticeship Theory in Higher Education Mathematics Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Blended learning design implementable in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments. Enhances accessibility in response to increased demand for non-face-to-face education post-COVID-19.

learning_goals: Learners can digitize and submit math problem-solving processes at least twice weekly using the smartphone-based MSFT platform and receive feedback
Learners can diagnose their error patterns with over 80% accuracy by analyzing instructors’ handwritten feedback
Learners enhance their conceptual application skills by reproducing model solution cases selected by instructors three or more times in VR simulation environments
Learners’ accuracy in solving math problems improves by over 30% through four weeks of formative assessments

resources: Tablet with handwriting recognition (for instructor use)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
